articles.author: Lewis Krauskopf
articles.description: A benign U.S. inflation report is bolstering the view that the Federal Reserve can bring down consumer prices without hurting the economy, a so-called Goldilocks environment that investors believe will support stocks and bonds.
articles.title: Goldilocks hopes return to Wall St after benign inflation report

articles.author: Tim Hepher, Alexander Cornwell, Pesha Magid
articles.description: Emirates ruled out an immediate deal to buy Airbus A350-1000 jets on Tuesday, blaming a dispute with engine maker Rolls-Royce over the durability of its engines and leaving the European planemaker without a major showcase order at the Dubai Airshow.
articles.title: Emirates holds off on Airbus A350 order in engine rift

articles.author: Nick Carey, Christina Amann
articles.description: The auto industry's drive to make electric vehicle motors with little to no rare earth content has hit high gear, with European, U.S. and Japanese automakers and suppliers racing for alternatives in an area dominated by China.
articles.title: Automakers' drive to avoid China's EV rare earth dominance gathers speed

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The U.S. Postal Service on Tuesday reported a $6.5 billion net loss for the 12 months ending Sept. 30 with revenue down 0.4% to $78.2 billion as mail volumes continued to fall.
articles.title: US Postal Service reports $6.5 billion net loss for 2023 fiscal year

articles.author: Divya Rajagopal
articles.description: As Glencore prepares for a long grind to convince Canada of the virtues of the Swiss trader-led consortium's $9 billion bid for Teck Resources' coal unit, investors and lawyers are optimistic about the deal approval despite the government's increased scrutiny of foreign investments.
articles.title: Canada likely to greenlight Glencore-Teck deal despite greater scrutiny of foreign deals

articles.author: Chibuike Oguh
articles.description: Shares of Fisker Inc (FSR.N) fell by more than 24% to an all-time low on Tuesday after the electric-vehicle startup slashed its production targets as it struggles to ramp up deliveries.
articles.title: EV maker Fisker plunges to all-time low after cutting production target

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Workers belonging to the United Auto Workers (UAW) union at General Motors' (GM.N) Spring Hill plant in Tennessee have voted against a proposed contract with the automaker, the union's vote tracker showed on Tuesday.
articles.title: UAW workers at GM's Spring Hill plant vote against tentative deal

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: U.S. President Joe Biden said hospitals in the Gaza Strip must be protected and he hoped for "less intrusive" action by Israel as Israeli tanks advanced to the gates of the besieged enclave's main hospital.
articles.title: Biden says Gaza hospitals 'must be protected'

articles.author: David Morgan, Richard Cowan
articles.description: U.S. House Speaker Mike Johnson will brave opposition from fellow Republicans and rely on Democratic votes on Tuesday in a risky tactic to avert a government shutdown.
articles.title: US House Speaker Johnson looks to Democrats to avert gov't shutdown

articles.author: Lucia Mutikani
articles.description: U.S. consumer prices were unchanged in October as Americans paid less for gasoline, and the annual increase in underlying inflation was the smallest in two years, bolstering views that the Federal Reserve was probably done raising interest rates.
articles.title: US consumer prices unchanged; core inflation slowing
